description: All UK political parties need to be honest about the painful fiscal choices facing the next government during the coming election campaign, the Institute for Fiscal Studies think tank said.
title: Next UK Government Faces Hardest Fiscal Challenge in 70 Years

description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. attacked former President Donald Trump on his response to the Covid-19 pandemic, as he sought to court votes from Libertarian Party members and bolster his independent presidential bid.
title: RFK Jr. Hits Trump’s Covid Response in Bid for Libertarian Vote

description: Police in Toronto plastered trespassing notices around a sprawling pro-Palestinian encampment at the University of Toronto on Friday, warning that the school will take “all necessary legal steps” to remove protesters if they don’t clear out soon.
title: University of Toronto Tells Pro-Palestinian Protesters to Leave Campus

description: Police raids in China to stem billions of dollars in illicit foreign-exchange transactions have highlighted the continuing use of cryptocurrencies there despite Beijing’s prohibition of digital-asset trading.
title: China’s Raids on Forex Gangs Point to Crypto Ban Being Flouted

description: Louisiana became the first state to make it a crime to possess the two main US abortion pills without a prescription, after a new law added mifepristone and misoprostol to the list of controlled substances like highly addictive narcotics.
title: Louisiana First in US to Make Possessing Abortion Pills a Crime

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, industrial policy reporter Mackenzie Hawkins outlines a bid by unions to organize workers in the semiconductor industry. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Unions See Opportunity in Biden Boosting Chip Plants

description: President Joe Biden plans to extend tariff exemptions on hundreds of products from China for two weeks as a transition period before reimposing duties on some of them, and will continue exclusions for some others until the middle of next year, the office of the US Trade Representative said.
title: Biden Extends Tariff Exemptions on Some Imports From China

description: Illinois’s budget for the year starting July 1 may not need cuts as deep as feared just a few weeks ago as negotiations continue on Friday, according to a spokesman for Governor J.B. Pritzker.
title: Illinois Governor Does Not Expect ‘Significant Cuts’ for 2025

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen voiced optimism about the progress of Group of Seven talks on a plan to use future profits from frozen Russia assets to help Ukraine, a move the group’s leaders will ultimately decide in June.
title: Yellen ‘Feeling Good’ About G-7 Alignment on Russian Assets

description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin will turn over his authorities to his deputy while he undergoes a medical procedure linked to a bladder issue that left him hospitalized for two weeks in January.
title: Lloyd Austin Will Hand Off Pentagon Duties While Undergoing Procedure

description: Blackstone Inc. Chief Executive Officer Steve Schwarzman says he will raise money for Donald Trump’s campaign, handing the presumptive Republican nominee a major win as he builds his donor base.
title: Schwarzman Plans to Back Trump, Scoring a Wall Street Win for GOP

description: China’s outsized role in world trade is alarming global finance chiefs, who are poised to forge a united front in Italy priming their nations to challenge “harmful practices.”
title: China Fear Grips G-7 With Draft Raising Alarm at ‘Harmful’ Trade

description: A Missouri state representative’s daughter and son-in-law were among three people killed in an attack in Haiti, where armed gangs have tightened their grip on the country.
title: Missouri Lawmaker’s Daughter Among Americans Killed in Haiti

description: Cabinet Minister Michael Gove, a key figure in the Conservative Party for over a decade, said he is standing down as a member of Parliament, a major blow to Prime Minister Rishi Sunak at the start of a six-week campaign to try prevent the Labour Party taking power at the July 4 general election.
title: Cabinet Minister Gove Joins Tory MP Exodus Before UK Election

description: Group of Seven finance ministers will lay the groundwork for using the profits from frozen Russia assets to help Ukraine, according a draft of the communique that they’re set to sign off on Saturday.
title: Ukraine Aid From Russian Assets Is Moving Forward in G-7 Draft

description: Giorgia Meloni linked Italy’s mammoth debt to its history of unstable governments, a preview of how she will argue in a future referendum for premiers such as herself to get a stronger mandate.
title: Meloni Blames Sky-High Debt on Italy Instability in Reform Push

description: Poland will analyze whether to reopen one border crossing with Belarus to facilitate trade between local communities, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said at a rally in an eastern city of Bialystok.
title: Poland to Analyze Whether to Reopen One Belarus Border Crossing

description: Colombia’s bonds and currency dived after President Gustavo Petro threatened to “cease payments” if lawmakers refuse to approve an increase in the nation’s debt ceiling.
title: Colombia Bonds, Peso Drop After Petro’s Debt Ceiling Threats

description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak ended months of speculation by calling for a general election to be held at the start of July. Here are answers to some key questions about the UK’s 2024 general election including the possible reasons why Sunak called it, the way voting works and what we might see in the two main party manifestos.
title: UK General Election 2024: When Is It And What Are The Key Issues?

description: As Israel’s assault against Hamas in Gaza grinds on and the civilian death toll grows, there’s been growing international pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to end the campaign. Netanyahu has rejected those calls, vowing to destroy the Palestinian militant group that killed hundreds of Israelis in an October raid. On Jan. 11, South Africa’s government called upon the International Court of Justice, the main judicial body of the United Nations, to rule Israel’s actions in Gaza to be ge
title: All About South Africa’s Genocide Case Against Israel

description: South Africa is making progress in rebuilding its institutions that uphold the rule of law but still has some way to go in rooting out corruption at power utility Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd., according to Public Enterprises Minister Pravin Gordhan.
title: South Africa’s War on Graft at Eskom is Ongoing, Gordhan Says

description: Rishi Sunak’s government has ditched the landmark smoking ban he said would transform future generations and save the National Health Service billions of pounds, after the prime minister’s decision to call an early UK election left too little time to get it through Parliament.
title: Sunak Casts Aside Legacy-Making Smoking Ban Ahead of UK Election

description: Donald Trump said that Nikki Haley will “absolutely” be on his team “in some form,” his strongest words of support yet for his former rival whom he spent months attacking during the Republican primary season.
title: Trump Says Haley Will Be Part of Team ‘In Some Form, Absolutely’

description: The legislation, a key part of a Tory push to be ‘pragmatic’ on climate targets, hasn’t finished all its parliamentary stages
title: UK Vote Means Sunak’s Offshore Oil and Gas Bill to Be Dropped

description: The United Nations’ top court ordered Israel to immediately halt its military operations in the Rafah region of the Gaza Strip, partially granting a request by South Africa in a case over genocide allegations.
title: Israel Ordered by UN Court to Halt Rafah Military Operations

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s main diplomatic push to secure broader global support against Russia’s invasion has suffered a double blow less than a month before leaders gather for a once-ambitious summit.
title: Ukraine’s Peace Project Is Dented by Rival Plan, Hollywood Cash

description: The Alternative for Germany lost ground in a new opinion poll, further evidence that a series of recent controversies is eroding support for the far-right party.
title: German Far-Right AfD Party Loses Ground After String of Scandals

description: Donald Trump’s historic hush money trial will soon be in the hands of a New York jury that must decide whether the former president falsified his company’s records to hide a hush money payment to porn star Stormy Daniels and influence the 2016 election.
title: What the Trump Jury Saw as Evidence Against Him in 12 Images

description: The United Nations peacekeeping chief argued against the latest calls for international troops to deploy in Gaza, saying the post-war state of affairs was too uncertain and that any operation would require agreement from Israel, which has been highly critical of the UN’s work in Palestinian territories.
title: Top UN Peacekeeper Says Arab League Call for Gaza Deployment Is Premature

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Modi’s Fragile Popularity Tested by Communist Party In India's Bengal

description: The Ukrainian military said it’s planning to seize back territory in the northeast after claiming that Russia’s offensive north of Kharkiv has stalled.
title: Ukraine Says It Will Push Back Russian Forces Near Kharkiv

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: MBS Juggles Saudi Vision With Regional Reality

description: The European Union would be delighted if it can forge a warmer relationship with a future UK government, according to the bloc’s economy commissioner, Paolo Gentiloni.
title: Closer UK Ties Would Make the EU ‘Very Happy,’ Gentiloni Says

description: The vice president also was the top choice among Democratic rising stars to run for the White House should Biden be unable to continue his campaign.
title: Kamala Harris Is Gaining Swing-State Voters' Trust to Step In for Biden

description: The European Union is discussing imposing sanctions on Iranian Defense Minister Mohammad-Reza Ashtiani, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Eyes Sanctioning Iran’s Defense Minister Over Drone Shipments

description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said the Group of Seven needs to establish a fair and in-depth assessment of excess Chinese industrial exports and the tools countries can use to address it.
title: France Calls for Shared G-7 Assesment of China Overcapacities

description: The earlier-than-expected UK election is prompting traders to prepare for the country’s biggest political shakeup since Brexit, despite the mostly muted market reaction since the announcement was made.
title: Stock Traders Prepare Game Plan for Biggest Shakeup Since Brexit

description: Russia “may be testing” the NATO member countries on its western frontier with recent actions linked to demarcating its borders, Finnish Prime Minister Petteri Orpo said.
title: Finnish Premier Says Russia ‘May Be Testing Us’ With Border Plan

description: Former Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn will stand as an independent candidate in the general election, a potentially awkward moment for his old party and Keir Starmer’s campaign to become UK prime minister.
title: Ex-Labour Leader Corbyn to Stand as Independent in UK Election

description: Protesters took to the streets in Taiwan as opposition lawmakers proceeded with a bill intended to curtail the powers of the new president, Lai Ching-te.
title: Taiwan Protesters Gather as Bill Aimed at President Moves Ahead

description: S&P Global Ratings said it’s closely monitoring the outcome of South Africa’s elections next week and subsequent government policies to address issues from crime to energy supply that have deterred investment.
title: Crime, Corruption Keep South Africa’s S&P Rating in Check

description: Hungary is working to “redefine” the country’s NATO membership status to allow for opt-outs should the military alliance undertake military actions outside of the defense alliance’s territory, Prime Minister Viktor Orban said.
title: Hungary Working to ‘Redefine’ Its NATO Membership, Orban Says

description: UK household energy bills will drop in July, the same week the country goes to the polls in an election where cost of living is a key issue.
title: UK Energy Bills to Fall 7% in July Just Before Election

description: South African Trade, Industry & Competition Minister Ebrahim Patel will quit the cabinet after next week’s election.
title: South African Trade Minister Will Quit Cabinet After Election

description: Singapore’s High Court ordered the estranged brother of former prime minister Lee Hsien Loong to pay S$400,000 ($295,800) for defaming two ministers.
title: Singapore Ex-PM’s Brother Must Pay S$400,000 for Defamation

description: The Philippines has opened a new coast guard station on an island near Taiwan to increase surveillance over an area that has seen a military buildup and frequent presence of Chinese vessels.
title: Philippines Opens New Station Near Taiwan to Bolster Security

description: The prime minister’s stoppage of the landmark HS2 rail project left Britons in a lurch. What could it take to resurrect it?
title: Sunak's Doom Loop Takes Britain Nowhere Fast

description: On this episode of Voternomics, Taiwan’s former digital affairs minister explains why grassroots efforts by humans can turn the tide.
title: How to Beat Back AI’s Threat to Democracy

description: On Merryn Talks Money, we discuss how a likely election rout of the Tories could empower Keir Starmer to make big changes that affect your money.
title: What Kind of Fireworks Does Labour Have Planned for July 4?

description: Kristin Johnson, a Democratic commissioner at the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, has emerged as a top candidate to lead the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.
title: CFTC’s Kristin Johnson a Leading Candidate to Be New FDIC Chair

description: Taiwan has become “one of the most dangerous flashpoints” in the region as the US-China rivalry intensifies, Singapore Deputy Prime Minister Gan Kim Yong said on Friday.
title: Singapore Sees Taiwan as One of Most ‘Dangerous Flashpoints’

description: Argentine President Javier Milei warned Thursday that his entire cabinet will be under review depending on the result of his pro-business reform bill grinding its way through Congress.
title: Milei Warns Cabinet’s Future Hinges On Argentina Congress Vote

description: Thailand is “working relentlessly” to bring an end to the crisis in neighboring Myanmar where rebel groups have been clashing with the military-government, according to Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin.
title: Thailand Working ‘Relentlessly’ to Solve Myanmar Crisis, PM Says
